oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Predicting dyscalcemia at 4 days in milk using activity and rumination data in multiparous Holstein cows
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Seely, C.
Seminara, J.
McArt, J.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Dyscalcemia, reduced blood calcium at 4 DIM, is associated with reduced milk production and reproduction and increased risk for negative health events. Cowside testing of blood calciÂ­um to diagnose dyscalcemia is difficult and alternative methods to identify dyscalcemia are needed. Our objectives were to use activity and rumination data to predict dyscalcemia.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; No. 56 (2023): 2023 Annual Conference Proceedings ; 212
